title: What Josh McDaniels said about facing the Raiders
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Josh McDaniels prepares to face the Raiders in Patriots' home opener two years after being fired by Las Vegas.
McDaniels reflects on learning from past failures, including his 9-16 record as Raiders head coach.
Discover McDaniels' thoughts on Raiders' coach Pete Carroll and Patriots' new lineup changes.

title: Elizabeth Banks cast as Karen Read: What readers said about the limited series role
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Elizabeth Banks will portray Karen Read in a Prime Video series about the murder case of Boston Police Officer John O’Keefe.
The series, co-produced by Banks and Justin Noble, will examine society’s fascination with true crime and institutional mistrust.
Some Boston.com poll participants suggested other actors like Anne Hathaway and Amanda Peet for the role—find out reader reactions.

title: 2 New England casinos just ranked the best in the U.S. (that aren’t in Las Vegas)
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Mohegan Sun and Foxwoods rank as top US casinos outside Las Vegas.
Mohegan Sun excels in slot machines and Asian table games.
Discover which casino secured the top non-Vegas spot according to USA Today.

title: What to know about Seisiún, the two-day Irish music festival coming to Boston
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Seisiún festival at Suffolk Downs features acts like Dropkick Murphys and The Pogues.
The Pogues make their first U.S. appearance in over 20 years, headlining Day 2.
Discover how Seisiún revives the spirit of the historic 1999 Fleadh festival.

title: CommonWealth Kitchen staff, members speak out over toxic nonprofit: Globe report
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: CommonWealth Kitchen accused of toxic work environment by staff and members.
Jen Faigel, executive director, criticized for fostering negative culture since 2014.
Members allege unmet promises and tokenization; find out how CWK responded.

title: 44 proposed Mass. ballot questions, including rent control, move to next step — and 3 don’t make the cut
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: 44 proposed Massachusetts ballot questions advance; 3 fail, per Attorney General Andrea Campbell.
Rent control, tax cuts, and same-day voter registration among key issues heading to potential 2026 ballot.
Discover why some proposals were disqualified and what's required for remaining initiatives to make the ballot.

title: RFK Jr. tries to defend COVID vaccine stance in raucous Senate hearing
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. faces bipartisan criticism during a heated Senate hearing on COVID-19 vaccine policies.
Kennedy defends firing the CDC director, disputing allegations of weakening public health protections.
Medical groups and Democrats demand Kennedy's resignation. Discover the specific accusations they level against him.

title: Juvenile with ‘airsoft replica weapon’ determined to have caused UMass Lowell lockdown
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: UMass Lowell campus experienced a three-hour lockdown due to a juvenile with an airsoft gun.
Multiple law enforcement agencies, including the FBI, responded to the scene on Wednesday afternoon.
Authorities are considering whether the juvenile will face criminal charges for the incident.

title: A new BBJ report rejiggers the list of state’s wealthiest zip codes. Here’s who’s on top now.
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Back Bay, 02116, is now the wealthiest zip code in Massachusetts, surpassing Dover from the previous year.
The Boston Business Journal's Wealth Index used data from Zillow and the Census Bureau for rankings.
Discover why the South End, despite a 24% poverty rate, ranks second on the wealthiest zip codes list.

title: Wu admin. to send nearly 100 recent police academy grads to Mass. and Cass
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Boston to deploy nearly 100 new police officers to Mass. and Cass area.
Increased police presence aims to curb outdoor substance use and crime.
Discover the city's expanded efforts to address addiction and homelessness.
